class quest.app.home_page.home_back_end.app_manager(env_path, env_act, env_cmd, script_path, app_del, env_del, solve=None, mod=None)[source]

Bases: object

Manages the installation and removal of applications within a specified environment.

This class handles the setup, activation, and execution of commands to manage application environments, including installation and removal processes.

install()[source]

Install the application by setting up and activating the environment.

This method checks if the environment directory exists and determines the appropriate activation command based on the operating system. It then starts a subprocess to run the installation command.

remove_app()[source]

Remove the application by deleting the specified environment.

This method starts a subprocess to run the command that deletes the environment associated with the application.

quest.app.home_page.home_back_end.simple_percent_parser(output)[source]

Match lines using the progress_re regex, returning a single integer for the % progress.

quest.app.home_page.home_page module

class quest.app.home_page.home_page.InfoPage(title, contact, info)[source]

Bases: QWidget

staticMetaObject = PySide6.QtCore.QMetaObject("InfoPage" inherits "QWidget": )
class quest.app.home_page.home_page.gui_connector(front_end, back_end, state)[source]

Bases: object

Connects the front-end GUI with the back-end logic for managing application installation and removal.

This class handles the interactions between the GUI elements and the back-end processes, updating the GUI based on the state of the application installation or removal.

app_removal()[source]

Display the removal progress and update the GUI accordingly.

This method sets the progress bar to indeterminate, disables the install button, and starts the removal process. It updates the button text to ‘Uninstalling’ and connects the back-end’s finished signal to reset the GUI.

install_display()[source]

Display the installation progress and update the GUI accordingly.

This method sets the progress bar to indeterminate, disables the install button, and starts the installation process. It updates the button text based on the installation status and connects the back-end’s finished signal to reset the GUI.

reset_gui()[source]

Reset the GUI elements to their default state after installation or removal.

This method sets the progress bar to determinate, enables the install button, and updates the button text based on the installation status.

class quest.app.home_page.home_page.info_drop(about_info, stacked)[source]

Bases: object

Manage the dynamic drop-down GUI updates.

This class handles the creation and management of information pages within a stacked widget, and provides methods to connect buttons to these pages.

about_page_drop(page_index)[source]

Navigate to the information page and animate the drop-down effect.

Parameters:

page_index (int) – The index of the page to navigate to.

add_page(title, contact, info)[source]

Add a new information page to the stacked widget.

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the information page.

  • contact (str) – The contact information to display.

  • info (str) – The additional information to display.

Returns:

The index of the newly added page in the stacked widget.

Return type:

int

connect_about(button, page_index)[source]

Connect a button to navigate to a specific information page.

Parameters:

  • button (QPushButton) – The button to connect.

  • page_index (int) – The index of the page to navigate to.
